page.title: 09CLUBS & SOCIETIES
page.content: For a small village with a population of about 500, Otterton has quite a lot of clubs and societies, where people spend their leisure time. This is what we found:- {Club name |M/bers| Leader | Meeting} ______________________________________ CUBS 15 MRS SCOTT Tues.even. GUIDES 12 MRS SCOTT Mon.evens. SCOUTS 2 MR SCOTT Thurs.even. BROWNIES 12 MRS SCOTT Mon.evens. W.I. 45 MRS SMITH Wed.evens. TWINNING 140 MR BAIN Irregular OVER 60'S 45 MRS DRAKE Tues.afts. S. SCHOOL 20 MRS WINSON Sun.morns. KEEP_FIT 8 MRS WINSON Tues.afts. FLOWER SHOW 10 MR PAYNE 1st Sat Nov BELLRINGERS 6 MR PITMAN Thurs.evens The{Twinning Association}has the largest membership. It was formed in 1976 and is a thriving feature of the social life of the area.
